bug.short_desc: can not set a default charset for sieve notifications

long_desc.thetext: Sieve has no mechanism to specify the default charset into which a notification or vacation message should be encoded. Some environments do not currently or are unable to support the UTF-8 charset. In such enviroments a method to specify the default charset of sieve notifications is necessary. Some ideas for selecting the default charset are: Set it to the charset of the received message. Allow the user to specify the charset in the sieve script. Allow the system adminstrator to specify the charset in sieve's configuration. All or some combination of the above. Always use UTF-8 and require usage of the :mime "message" option.
